The University of Texas
DEPARTMENT OF SPEECH
AUSTIN 12, TEXAS
November 3, 1952
Mr. Graydon Ausmus, Vice-President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
P. 0. Box 2002
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
I was very happy to hear from you and to know that your group is
considering Gale Adkins for the Executive Directorship of the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters.
As you know, Gale has been connected with the University for 6 or
7 years. Although I did not know him before the war, I have come to
know and appreciate him very much since my return from the Air Forces.
We have found Gale to be a capable administrator and exceptionally well-
qualified in educational radio. I understand that he has completed all
of his work toward the Ph. D. degree except the dissertation. He is a
young man of very pleasant and congenial personality, cooperative, and
industrious. It is my opinion that he would make an excellent Executive
Director and would bring into the position a superior ability, particuÂ¬
larly in dealing with education people.
Dr. Dolley sent me a copy of the letter he wrote you in regard to
Gale, and I should like to add one further fact here. As Acting
Director of Radio House, Gale has indicated again an excellent ability
in administration and in coordinating the efforts of the various members
of Radio House.
It is a pleasure to recommend Gale to you as a person of excellent
ability and very good potentiality in the field of educational radio.
Cordially yours
T. A. Rousse, Chairman
Department of Speech
